main_definition: To bring something down to a lower position, level or degree; also used as an idiom with different meanings depending on the context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reduce in height, level or value
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of hard work, she finally managed to lower her debt.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make clothes that fit larger sizes
meanings_and_examples.example: The store offers a wide range of plus-size clothing for all body types.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move or bring down something to a lower position
meanings_and_examples.example: He had to lower the flag during the ceremony out of respect.
The weather forecast predicts that temperatures will drop significantly overnight, so be sure to bundle up!

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give less authority or importance
meanings_and_examples.example: In the meeting, he tried to lower his colleague's ego by suggesting a different approach.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reduce the price of something
meanings_and_examples.example: The store is having a sale and all items are 20% off!
